qas.question: How did the republic of liberia begin?

answers.text: as a settlement of the American Colonization Society (ACS)

qas.question: When did the Republic of Liberia declare it's independence?
When did the united states recognize the republic of Liberia's independence?
How many slaves were freed in the american civil war?
What was the Liberian flag and constitution modeled after?
What is the oldest country in Africa?
When did the American Civil War end?
How many Liberians fled to the United States during the Civil War?
Who led a coup to overthrow the Liberian government in 1948?
What country did Liberia gain independence from?

context: <b5_0>The Republic of Liberia<b5_0/>, beginning <a0_0>as a settlement of the American Colonization Society (ACS)<a0_0/>, declared its independence on <a1_0>July 26, 1847<a1_0/>. The United States did not recognize Liberia's independence until during the American Civil War on <a2_0><b6_0>February 5, 1862<b6_0/>. Between January 7, 182<a2_0/>2 and the American Civil War, <a3_0>more than <b7_0>15,000<b7_0/><a3_0/> freed and free-born Black Americans from United States and 3,198 Afro-Caribbeans relocated to the settlement. The Black American settlers carried their culture with them to Liberia. The Liberian constitution and flag were modeled after <a4_0>the <b9_0>United States<b9_0/><a4_0/>. In January 3, 1848 <b8_0>Joseph Jenkins Roberts<b8_0/>, a wealthy free-born Black American from Virginia who settled in Liberia, was elected as Liberia's first president after the people proclaimed independence.
